quoteFirst: Upon my arrival at the hospital, an additional ligature was placed around my wrist. At 8:30 a.m. a small incision was made in the end of the finger, which by this time was beginning to darken at the point of venom deposition. I sucked on the finger until
quoteLast: , when a pan of ice water that I had requested was brought to me. No pain was felt except that caused by the ice. Fresh ice was added as needed to keep the temperature low. By 9:30 a.m. the finger had swollen and stiffened. At 10:00 a.m. the swelling had progressed to the index finger and back of the hand.

quoteFirst: Advance from the Frezenberg Ridge was resumed at
quoteLast: The dispositions of the 28th Brigade remained unaltered, but in the 26th the Camerons passed through the Seaforths and Black Watch. At 2.40 P.M. we passed the second of the three noggurs that sailed yesterday, and at 3 P.M. we passed the third exactly at the Giraffe junction. We have thus been six hours and twenty-five minutes from the Sobat to the Giraffe junction. Thermometer, 6 A.M., 66 degrees; noon, 86 degrees.

quoteFirst: At last a landing was resolved on, and at
quoteLast: the general signal was made, "Prepare to land marines," followed ten minutes later by the order, "Prepare to land brigade of seamen." The _Helicon_, _Bittern_ and _Beacon_ were despatched to the outside squadron to bring in as many men as possible, whilst the _Condor_ and _Cygnet_ were told off to take the seamen and marines from the inshore vessels. quoteFirst: I was set to washing, and I asked the "boss" attendant, "How long will I have to work?" He replied, "three or four hours," the same as the attendant had told me at the door when I entered. However, after working from half-past six until
quoteLast: --kept in there just at the time when I ought to have been out looking for work--I was allowed to go.
